thread.section_title: Travel: Travel News, Guides, Deals, Hotels, Vacation Ideas & More - The Washington Post
thread.title: The week’s best travel deals from around the globe
thread.title_full: The week’s best travel deals from around the globe - The Washington Post

author: By Carol Sottili
title: The week’s best travel deals from around the globe
text:
By Carol Sottili and Andrea Sachs July 2 at 6:23 PM This week’s best travel bargains around the globe.
Land Wilderness Travel is taking $600 off 2016 safari vacations in Tanzania . The 13-day Serengeti Wildlife Safari now starts at $7,595 per person double if 10 people or more sign up and at $7,995 for four to nine guests. Price includes four nights in deluxe game lodges, eight nights in exclusive private camps, all meals, game drives and walks, and taxes. The itinerary includes Tarangire National Park, Ngorongoro Crater and the Serengeti National Park; park fees of $1,550 are extra. Select departures January-December (no October or November dates). Info: 800-368-2794, www.wildernesstravel.com.
Nemi Eco Villa, a luxury sustainable property in Puerto Vallarta , Mexico, has an R&R package through Sept. 1. The deal costs $1,950 and includes three nights’ accommodations for up to six people, daily breakfast, two group yoga sessions , one 60-minute massage or chiropractic adjustment per room, welcome cocktails and snacks; and taxes. Minimum three-night stay required. The usual off-season rate is starts at $800. Info: 888-276-1953, nemiecovilla.com .
Nolitan Hotel in Manhattan’s SoHo neighborhood is offering the Helloooo Summer deal, with savings of up to 25 percent this summer. Rates vary. For example, a Sunday night in July starts at $175, with taxes, a savings of $59; a Friday stay in mid-August starts at $261, a savings of $86. Travel through Sept. 7.
Info: 212-925-2555, www.nolitanhotel.com .
Sea Princess Cruises has launched a sale with discounts of up to 35 percent , shipboard credits and reduced fares for the third and fourth passengers . For example, on the 10-night Caribbean Islander cruise sailing from New York on Oct. 24, the first two passengers now pay $709 each, and the third and fourth travelers pay $299 each for a shared interior cabin — a savings of about $980. Add about $126 each for port charges. The promo also includes a $100 shipboard credit for an interior cabin (higher-category cabins receive larger credits). Book the Red, White & Blue sale by July 7; request promo code R6J.
Info: 800-774-6237, www.princess.com .
Air United Airlines has sale fares to Europe for travel Aug. 23-
Oct. 31. Nonstop fare from Washington Dulles to London, for example, starts at $1,000 round trip, including taxes. Other airlines are matching. Restrictions vary, with some destinations requiring a 10-night stay. Book by July 8 at www.united.com .
Package Save $300 per person on a South Africa Sampler tour with Goway Travel. The trip now starts at $2,799 per person double and includes air from Washington Dulles to Johannesburg, with return from Cape Town; 14 nights in 10 hotels; 18 meals; safari in Kruger National Park; several guided tours; land transportation; airport transfers; and taxes. For lowest price, depart Sept. 19. Book by July 31. Info: 800-557-2841, www.goway.com .
Save hundreds on domestic and international packages booked by July 12 with Go Ahead Tours. For example, the Food and Wine: Southern Italy and Sicily tour departing Sept. 25 is $7,538 for two travelers (down from $8,528) and includes round-trip air from Washington Dulles to Sicily; 11 nights’ accommodations; daily breakfast, one lunch and five three-course dinners; three wine tastings and a cooking lesson; private motor coach and guided sightseeing; select entrance fees; and taxes. Other trips on sale include Oktoberfest: Historic Germany; Charleston to Savannah: The Antebellum South; and Costa Rica: Rainforests, Volcanoes & Wildlife. Info: 877-260-2041, www.goaheadtours.com.
— Carol Sottili , Andrea Sachs
Submit travel deals to whatsthedeal@washpost.com . Prices were verified at press time Thursday, but deals sell out and availability is not guaranteed. Some restrictions may apply.
